paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted genetic variant information for TTR gene mutations associated with hereditary transthyretin amyloidosis with polyneuropathy (ATTR-PN).

individual_records.evidence_sentence: The first patient, a 75-year-old East Asian female (SCVIi091-A), possessed the pathogenic c.349G > T variant, resulting in the Ala97Ser mutation.

functional_data.summary: iPSC lines derived from patients exhibited normal morphology and pluripotency marker expression.

variants.additional_notes: The variant is associated with hereditary amyloidosis.
key_quotes: These iPSC lines exhibited normal morphology, karyotype, high pluripotency marker expression, and differentiation into cells representing all germ layers.

individual_records.evidence_sentence: The second patient, a 68-year-old Caucasian female (SCVIi092-A), carried the pathogenic c.250 T > C variant, leading to the Phe64Leu mutation.

functional_data.summary: iPSC lines derived from patients exhibited normal morphology and pluripotency marker expression.

variants.additional_notes: The variant is associated with hereditary amyloidosis.
key_quotes: These iPSC lines exhibited normal morphology, karyotype, high pluripotency marker expression, and differentiation into cells representing all germ layers.

extraction_metadata.notes: All relevant data extracted from the main text.
